intro: Collomia renacta, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Collomia renacta is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
